page.title: 06AGRICULTURE IN GT. WAKERING
page.content: THE TYPE OF FARMING THAT TAKES PLACE IN OUR AREA IS TYPICAL OF THAT OF SOUTH EAST ENGLAND. THE FARMERS EITHER GROW CEREAL CROPS OR VEGATABLES IN SOME SORT OF ROTATION. THE REASON FOR THIS IS THAT THE CLIMATE AND SOIL IS SUITABLE FOR CEREAL CROPS AND THERE IS A LARGE RESIDENTIAL AREA NEARBY SO THERE IS A SUITABLE MARKET FOR THE VEGETABLE PRODUCE. THERE USED TO BE A LOT OF SHEEP FARMING AND DAIRY FARMING BUT BECAUSE OF GOVERNMENT POLICIES AND THE COMMON MARKET IT IS MORE PROFITABLE FOR FARMERS TO GROW CEREAL CROPS THAN ANYTHING ELSE. THEREFORE A LOT OF GRAZING LAND HAS RECENTLY BEEN PLOUGHED UP. THERE IS ALSO A LOT OF PLOUGHING UP OF THE HEDGEROWS TAKING PLACE TO MAKE LARGER FIELDS AND ALSO A LOT OF ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS USED WHICH IS AFFECTING THE WILDLIFE IN THIS AREA.
